I'm using in the CVS Repositories perspective the context menu on a module of 
HEAD. I choose 'Configure Branches and Versions...'. The Dialog displays no 
branches and versions on the selected folder. Then I got:

children of HEAD".

What version of Eclipse are you using? Was there anything in the error log?

And what about the error log? Was tghere anything that mentioned CVS in there?
(There is an Error log view that allows you to browse the contents of the error log)

The console for CVS is empty. (In the CVS preferences, the 'Display detailed 
protocol output to stdout (for debugging purposes)' is checked.)

The CVS Repository uses watch/edit.

Is that all there was? I have enough information to fix the NPE but was trying 
to deduce why the checkout of the defined modules was failing. If you want to 
find out as well, you can follow the steps at this URL to get a trace of the 
communications between the client and server (just enabling the preference is 
not enough):

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-vcm-
home/docs/online/cvs_features2.0/cvs-faq.html#misc_0

If you get a trace, attach it to this bug report.

Fix for NPE has been released to HEAD. I don't know why the fetch  of the 
defined modules failed. If it happens now, the error will be logged but the 
repositories view will still show the folders.

It looks like we got some of the modules and then received an error. My guess 
is the error is due to an invalid module in the CVSROOT/modules file. From our 
side, in the very least, we should improve the error message so the use may 
have some idea as to what went wrong. Idealy, we could also show the modules 
we did manage to fetch bit this isn't as important as identifying the error.

This 'invalid option --i' comes from the modules file (CVS).

The modules file contains a line:
rcsinfo		-i CVSROOT rcsinfo


The description in the modules file states, that -i is valid:
--------
# Three different line formats are valid:
#	key	-a    aliases...
#	key [options] directory
#	key [options] directory files...
#
# Where "options" are composed of:
#	-i prog		Run "prog" on "cvs commit" from top-level of module.
#	-o prog		Run "prog" on "cvs checkout" of module.
#	-e prog		Run "prog" on "cvs export" of module.
#	-t prog		Run "prog" on "cvs rtag" of module.
#	-u prog		Run "prog" on "cvs update" of module.
#	-d dir		Place module in directory "dir" instead of module name.
#	-l		Top-level directory only -- do not recurse.
#
# NOTE:  If you change any of the "Run" options above, you'll have to
# release and re-checkout any working directories of these modules.
#
# And "directory" is a path to a directory relative to $CVSROOT.
#
# The "-a" option specifies an alias.  An alias is interpreted as if
# everything on the right of the "-a" had been typed on the command line.
#
# You can encode a module within a module by using the special '&'
# character to interpose another module into the current module.  This
# can be useful for creating a module that consists of many directories
# spread out over the entire source repository.
----------

The error itself is coming from the CVS server itself. Either their is a bug 
in the CVS server or the dicumenation is incorrect. You would have to ask the 
CVS server people about this. All we can do in Eclipse is handle the error 
better.
*** Bug 76153 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 114092 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
